Authors:
Joao B. A. Bringel Jr., Jose Floriano Barea Pastore,
Taciana Barbosa Cavalcanti
Title:
A new unusual species of Bidens (Asteraceae: Coreopsideae)
and its phylogenetic position with taxonomic notes
Keywords:
Compositae, Cerrado endemic species, taxonomy,
typification
Abstract:
A new and unusual species was discovered and had its
morphological and phylogenetic relationships with other species
discussed. The ITS phylogeny supported the placement of the new species
in the genus Bidens. The new species displays style and cypsela like
most species of Bidens, however presents a widely campanulate corolla
with long lobes, a extremely reduced involucre, and the pappus lacking
awns, an unusual set of characteristics for the genus. A key to the
species is accompanied by comments and illustrations of related species.
Bidens goiana B.L.Turner is placed as synonym of B. graveolens Mart. and
a lectotype for B. brasiliensis is designated.
